intro: Euphrasia curtidens, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, grassy habitats and has a short, creeping stem with opposite leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Euphrasia curtidens is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
